titlestmt.titleproper: Berkeley, CA. Grace North Church records, 1891-2016. RG5473
titlestmt.author: Billy McCarthy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-02 19:42:42 +0000.

did.unittitle: Berkeley, CA. Grace North Church records, 1891-2016.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Congregational Church of North Berkeley (Berkeley, Calif.)

did.abstract: The North Grace Church's origins begin at a meeting on June 28, 1892 with twenty-four "charter members." The newly formed church, then called the Congregational Church of North Berkeley, would be led by Rev. David F. Taylor. The church would close as North Congregational Church in 1992. The church would make a return in 1995 as Grace North Church and remain open until 2023. This collection contains various records from across Grace North Church and includes topics like vital statistics, church reports and meeting minutes, auxiliary organizations, finances, histories and publications, and church buildings.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Berkeley, CA. Grace North Church records, 1891-2016, RG5473. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Ric Reed, secretary of North Grace Church in August 2023; 2023-38.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection was processed in January 2024 by Billy McCarthy using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The North Grace Church's origins begin at a meeting on June 28, 1892, moderated by Rev. J.K. McLean and Rev. E.F. Dinsmore as the scribe. At this meeting, articles of faith and a covenant were accepted by twenty-six members. Two people would drop shortly after, leaving the new church with twenty-four "charter members." The newly formed church, then called the Congregational Church of North Berkeley, would be led by Rev. David F. Taylor. A new church building would be dedicated on May 21, 1893, at the southwest corner of Cedar and Oxford Streets.

The Church would be officially incorporated in California on September 25, 1895. The church's membership would be around 147 members in 1904, twelve years after being formed. The following year, the church building was moved to the rear of the lot and elevated to house Sunday School rooms, pastor's study, and parlor. Out of this Sunday School grew the Chinese branch of North Church which would go on to become Berkeley Chines Church in 1914.

The now called North Church steadily moved through the Depression and into the 1940s. On September 7, 1944, the church building was destroyed in a fire. The congregation would meet at various other locations for a couple of years until a new building was completed on January 16, 1949. Much of the process was led by Rev. Eugene Haynes alongside numerous other members of the community.

In 1960, the North Congregational Church decided to join the United Church of Christ. This membership would last until 1968, when the church would join the National Association of Congregational Christian Churches. The church would progress through the 1970s, closing their Sunday School in 1975 due to low attendance. The church's overall membership would see decline through the 1980s, though benevolent giving continued to be strong. Continued decline in membership led to the church agreeing to close its doors in 1992, giving the land over to the National Association of Congregational Christian Churches.

The closure in 1992 was not the end of the story and in 1995 fourteen former members of the North Congregational Church asked the Grace Institute to join and form a new church which would eventually be called Grace North Church. The Institute was filled with former members of the North Congregational Church and worshipped in the same building. Thus, the legacy of North Congregational Church was taken on by the Grace North Church. They rejoined the National Association of Congregational Christian Churches in June of 1995. This Grace North Church would continue to serve the community until it officially closed in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various records from across Grace North Church and includes topics like vital statistics, church reports and meeting minutes, auxiliary organizations, finances, histories and publications, and church buildings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into five series from the Grace North Church. The Church Reports and Meeting Minutes series and the Auxiliary Organizations series have been further divdied into subseries. All of the series and subseries have been arranged into chronological order.
Series 2: Church Reports and Meeting Minutes, 1892-2010

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: North Congregational Church: A History of 75 Years. Berkeley: Andlyn Press, 1967.

controlaccess.corpname: Congregational Church of North Berkeley (Berkeley, Calif.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the vital statistics from the church and include baptisms, admissions, dismissions, memorials and various guest books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains church reports, annual reports, and meeting minutes from a variety of different boards and committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meeting minutes from the Board of Trustees, Board of Directors, Mission Society, Advisory Committee, Parish Meetings, and a special meeting on disbanding the North Congregational Church.

did.unittitle: Meeting on disbanding North Congregational Church

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains church and annual reports, as well as a single report from the 2005 National Association of Congregational Christian Churches meeting held in Kansas City

did.unittitle: Report from Kansas City NACCC meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records for several auxiliary organizations of the Grace North Church, such as the Ladies' Aid Society, the Bay Association, and the Grace Institute of Religious Learning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meeting minutes and finances for the Ladies' Aid Society for the Grace North Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meeting minutes for the Bay Association of the Grace North Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the finances, bylaws, exemption applications, and the records of Rev. Richard Mapplebeckpalmer.

did.unittitle: Grace Institute of Religious Learning finance reports and budget
Grace Institute of Religious Learning bylaws
Grace Institute of Religious Learning exemption application
Grace Institute of Religious Learning records of Rev. Richard Mapplebeckpalmer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains financial ledgers from the church.
